Hi,

I got the same error message ("??? Undefined command/function 'ctmetho=
ds'.")while attempting to run a MATLAB demo.  I did compiled Cantera and th=
e toolbox.  In fact, I successfully ran some Python and C++ demos but only =
had problems with MATLAB.  I've checked:
1. That the environmental variable=
 MATLAB_CMD is set to the MATLAB executable file
2. I ran the mex -setup co=
mmand in Matlab and selected Visual C++ from the list of available compiler=
s.
3. Set the Cantera Toolbax as a path in Matlab

What am I missing?  Any =
suggestions?  
Thanks,
Alejandro

Asunto: Re: [cantera] Matlab Toolbox : problem with ctmethods

> Did you =
compile Cantera and the toolbox? The zip file has source 
> code  
> only, =
and needs to be compiled with Visual C++ .NET. If you don't  
> want to com=
pile, then install from the Windows installer file  
> (.msi).  It may requ=
ire MATLAB R2006b, however.
> 
> 
>
